Very good suggestion. What if we could also add Minecraft Earth mobs into the game too? As of now, the gameâ€™s over world land still feels a bit lackluster. These mob variants could have special abilities or features like speed nutrition or saturation from the meat, or anything else like that. This can also give another reason to explore. Iâ€™m sure a lot of us had the idea of making a petting zoo. And hey! The land isnâ€™t alone the Update Aquatic still lacks a few things. Maybe things like whales and squid variants maybe the squids could drop a piece of their body that can make a good food source. Now they wonâ€™t be useless other than say black dye.

I love the idea for Camoflauged Creepers, and I think it makes sense as they are supposed to creep around and being able to hide would make that easier. The Camoflauge Creeper Mod does this, but I wouldn't do it exactly the same. In that mod, they seem to perfectly change color to match the block they are on, but I would make it so they keep the same texture but the colors are just changed. At the very least, Creepers should match the color of the grass in whatever biome they are in. Then, they could turn more grey with stone, beige with sand, and maybe even brown for planks. For all other blocks, they shouldn't be able to blend in well or at all. They may only do this on Hard Difficulty

Mob votes wouldn't exist if all 3 were to be added, there'd be no point/nothing to vote for.

Mob votes kinda suck in general, and leave a large portion of the fanbase disappointed. What they should do, is recycle older mob vote mobs. The ones that nobody wants won't get voted for, and after many tries it will get scrapped, effectively giving them all a higher chance to get in the game.

However, in order for it to stay fair, they would need to make sure all three mobs have fairly equal uses. The Rascal and Tuff Golem have barely any use but the Sniffer promises new plants... so there is an obvious unbalance. If (for example) it was the Rascal, Tuff Golem, and the Glare they would be more on par with each other in usefulness. The Iceologer would have faired better if it actually competed with other hostile mobs.

On a side note, only voting for two mobs at once would make it more even, instead of having the community split between three decisions it would be actually fair and let the players vote on which mob they actually want. Currently, everyone who voted for the vetoed mob has to pick between two mobs they weren't necessarily wanting in the first place.
Yeah but i just think all of the mobs this year are cool enough to be a part of Minecraft.

I think something else would be cool;

Polar bears aren't grizzlies - they don't eat salmon. And while adding seals to beach type biomes would be for the best, having polar bears be powerful predators of *all* mobs wiuld be next best.

They should attack the player on sight too, and should deal a lot of damage and have a little more hp as well.

Currently I agree that they are a useless mob.

I very much agree with your idea and have been very interested in seeing. I really like the idea of using the fox mechanic for fish. I would just think it would be much more interesting if the polar bears used the fishing mechanic and rather than hunt the salmon entities, they fish like the fishing rod but only catch salmon. They they could feed they baby polar bears by dropping it and picking it up like the foxes. But yea this is defiantly something that is needed to spice up this bland mob

They could ocasionally swim to the Ocean, dive their heads in, catch a salmon with their mouth, go back to the shore, and leave behind and drop leftover bones and raw fish on the ground after eating the fish in their mouth. This would give the players a reason to leave Polar Bears alone instead of killing them for food (they drop fishes).
While they're at it, why not give Java edition a variety of Salmon sizes like with Bedrock.
